parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and pipto; to fall aside, i.e. to apostatize.
To make fresh again, renew, restore. From ana and a derivative of kainos; to restore.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To impede, crucify (again). From ana and stauroo; to recrucify.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From para and deigmatizo; to show alongside, i.e. Expose to infamy.
